video.title: Unity Game Dev Full Tutorial - 3D Snake Game
video.description:
Learn to create a 3D snake game with Unity in this complete tutorial for beginners.

Assets for Tutorial: https://github.com/AwesomeTuts/3d-snake-tutorial/blob/master/3D%20Snake%20Assets.zip

Tutorial covers:
1. Importing Assets And Preparing Our Gameplay Scene
2. Moving The Snake
3. Controlling The Snakes Movement
4. Detecting Collision And Adding Collectable Items
5. Wrapping Up Our Game

Tutorial created by Awesome Tuts. Check out Awesome Tuts Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5c-DuzPdH9iaWYdI0v0uzw

On the Awesome Tuts website, you can learn to create a game in 40 minutes: https://www.awesometuts.com/from-scratch-to-game-ws

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

replies.author: Schello
replies.text:
PlayerDirection is called from Tags.cs // around public enum PlayerDirection. It shouldn't be a namespace. Make sure your namespace is PlayerController at the top of the script. Like this: 

public class PlayerController : MonoBehaviour

topLevelComment.author: moue
topLevelComment.text: I know this is old and all, but the "Random.Range" isn't working anymore, I'm getting an error in Unity.

replies.author: moue
replies.text: @Schello no worries, thanks for the reply. I figured it out, no big deal.

replies.author: Schello
replies.text:
There are two 'Random' classes. One in UnityEngine and the other in System. What you need is the UnityEngine one.

At the top of your PlayerController script, just under "using UnityEngine" add this:

using Random = UnityEngine.Random;

Now you should be able to use Random.Range
